questions.question_text:
Identify a correct statement about the expiration date of the "Letter of Authorization and Connecting Facility Assignment (LOA-CFA)," which lets you complete the
Cross Connect step of setting up your AWS Direct Connect.

choices.B: If the virtual interface is not created within 72 days, the LOA-CFA becomes outdated.
choices.A: If the cross connect is not completed within 90 days, the authority granted by the LOA-CFA expires.
choices.D: If the cross connect is not completed within the specified duration from the appropriate provider, the LOA-CFA expires.
choices.C: If the cross connect is not completed within a user-defined time, the authority granted by the LOA- CFA expires.

comments.content:
Option C states that the cross connect is not completed within a user-defined time. This is also incorrect. The LOA-CFA has a specific expiration date, which is 90 days. The user does not have the ability to define a different expiration date.

Option D states that the cross connect is not completed within the specified duration from the appropriate provider. This is also incorrect. The LOA-CFA is issued by AWS, not by the colocation provider. The expiration date of the LOA-CFA is not dependent on the colocation provider.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. If the cross connect is not completed within 90 days, the authority granted by the LOA-CFA expires.

The LOA-CFA is a document that is issued by AWS to authorize you to create a cross connect at a colocation facility. The LOA-CFA is valid for 90 days, and if the cross connect is not completed within that time, the authority granted by the LOA-CFA expires.

The other options are incorrect. Option B states that the LOA-CFA becomes outdated if the virtual interface is not created within 72 days. This is not correct. The virtual interface is created after the cross connect is completed, so it is not possible for the LOA-CFA to become outdated before the cross connect is even created.

questions.question_text:
A read only news reporting site with a combined web and application tier and a database tier that receives large and unpredictable traffic demands must be able to respond to these traffic fluctuations automatically.
What AWS services should be used meet these requirements?

discussion.content: A. Stateless instances for the web and application tier synchronized using ElastiCache Memcached in an autoscaimg group monitored with CloudWatch and RDS with read replicas.

For a read-only news reporting site that needs to handle unpredictable traffic demands, the architecture should be designed for high availability and scalability. Let's evaluate the options:

A. Stateless instances for the web and application tier synchronized using ElastiCache Memcached in an autoscaling group monitored with CloudWatch and RDS with read replicas.

Stateless instances are ideal for scalability since they don't maintain any session information. If one instance fails, users can be directed to another instance without any disruption.
ElastiCache Memcached can be used to cache frequent database queries or session data, reducing the load on the database.
Autoscaling ensures that the application can scale out or in based on demand.
CloudWatch monitors the performance and can trigger scaling actions.
RDS with read replicas can handle a large number of read requests by distributing the load across multiple replicas.
Why we would need ElastiCache to sync web/app tier up if they are stateless?

questions.answer_description:
A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) is a virtual network dedicated to the user's AWS account. A user can create a subnet with VPC and launch instances inside the subnet. The user can create a subnet with the same size of VPC. However, he cannot create any other subnet since the CIDR of the second subnet will conflict with the first subnet. The user cannot modify the CIDR of a subnet once it is created. Thus, in this case if required, the user has to delete the subnet and create new subnets.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Subnets.html

How can the user create the second subnet?

choices.A: The user can modify the first subnet CIDR with AWS CLI
choices.B: The user can modify the first subnet CIDR from the console
choices.C: There is no need to update the subnet as VPC automatically adjusts the CIDR of the first subnet based on the second subnet's CIDR
choices.D: It is not possible to create a second subnet with overlapping IP CIDR without deleting the first subnet.
